cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 530 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf toward the central/upper Texas coast

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts expected along the Texas coast; lesser effects possible western Louisiana coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – locally up to 4 inches possible
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at the port (≤3% chance of sustained 34-kt winds).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland port; only minor tidal fluctuations on the lower Mississippi River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Friday into early Saturday could total 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts, producing ponding and localized flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Gusty squalls may affect marine traffic on the lower Mississippi River; increased river currents and reduced visibility in heavy rain.
